reviewText: So many comics these days rely on sex and curse words in order to evoke a laugh.  Not so with Trevor Noah.  While not adverse to using a curse word - sparingly - and making sexual innuendos - with taste and real humor - Trevor Noah relies on observation and imitation of things we Americans take for granted but are ever so strange to those who come from other parts of the world.  There is a real intellect at work here.  His observations are on target, brilliantly realized, brilliantly executed, and thus really, really funny.  Don't miss this comic.  He's a genius.

I loved Trevor because he demonstrated that you don't have to use crude and vulgar language to be funny. Evidently, he believes it doesn't belong in comedy and I agree. He was able to hold my interest and wonder what's next, and he's really cute.

Most comedy these days tends to be inflammatory and loaded with vulgar.  Trevor Noah's brand of comedy, on the other hand, is very intelligent and insightful.  I tend to liken his style to that of Franklin Ajaye, Jerry Seinfeld and even Sinbad.

On this particular video, much of what he talks about relates to his trek from South Africa to America and his perspectives between the two.  There are keen observations about culture, ethnicity, and society which are delivered with wit and which will leave you laughing out loud.

I actually watched the video yesterday afternoon and found myself with tears in my eyes.  I liked it so much that I watched it again when I returned home in the evening.  During this second viewing, I still found myself laughing although I knew what was coming up next in Trevor Noah's presentation.

I don't think Trevor Noah is yet a big name on the US comedy scene yet.  However, based upon what I saw in the video, I sense he's got a bright future ahead of him.

Trevor's routine was wonderfully fresh and amazing. He kept me hooked throughout the entire performance. Hilariously awe inspiring takes on controversial issues will make you laugh at his jokes and at yourself. Brilliant!

This is awesome. He's so funny and doesn't curse to make it FUNNY!
Kids appropriate comedy.
Never a dull moments with him.

This review is of AFRICAN-AMERICAN stand-up show only.  We haven't seen any others yet!

We watched this show over the past three nights and laughed until tears ran down our cheeks!  We are 55+ so this really appealed to our older sense of humor!  This man is so talented it's not funny.  He speaks at least 6 languages, is extremely intelligent, articulate, humorous, and doesn't use filthy cuss words for shock value or for a laugh!

He takes the part of the other person that he is talking to in his stand-up act, which really makes it quite hilarious! We respect, admire and LOVE this adorable guy!  So, unless you have zero sense of humor, you will laugh your socks off during his African-American show! He covers dozens of different topics so don't think it's only about that! We are getting this for our kids so they can enjoy it too!

I'd say if you watch his stand up, you shouldn't eat or drink during as you may choke to death from uncontrollable laughter!

Aug 1, 2013

Brilliant. Fresh. Intelligent. Insightful. Hilarious. For me, the best comedians are those that can extract or point out the funny in everyday life and interactions, whether its pop culture, news, etc. Combined with spot-on impressions. That is what real comedic talent is all about. This kid has it.

Ecstatic that someone with his vision was chosen to fill Jon Stewart's shoes I was confident he could bring us even broader views. Always a Daily Show watcher, now it's needed badly. Comedic clarity for these trying times.

Noah is soft-spoken, self-deprecating, and polished. Unlike many of his peers, he doesn't rely on shock value for laughs. Instead, he's a consummate storyteller. He's turned his life - from childhood poverty in apartheid South Africa to success as a stand-up comedian - into a series of unexpectedly funny anecdotes. He's so engaging, he even carries the audience along when he gets serious. After seeing "African American," you'll understand why Jon Stewart chose Noah as the new anchor of "The Daily Show."

Trevor is a unique comic for we Americans. He seems to know quite a lot of the world in general and his British sounding South African accent gives him an air of intelligence. He has a great life story which he shares with humor and a touch of pathos. Not loud or vulgar, his delivery is still full of energy and a great deal of thoughtfulness.
A fresh take on race in America. A foreigner makes some timely observations when he travels to the United States.

Intelligent, honest, and hilarious is how I would describe Trevor Noah. I have not seen any of his other stand-ups, but this one I have watch three times. Before I watched this video Kevin Hart was the only comedian I have watched who made me laugh throughout the show. As it stands right now I rate this one up there with Kevin Harts older stand-up show, the one centered around his young family. I was laughing throughout Trevor's act, and crying laughing at times, with his look at America through the lens of a South African, "mixed race" man. Excellent show I recommend to all my friends.

Here is a charming, witty young man from South Africa with some interesting insights about America. He has an amazing talent for imitating American accents, from Southerners to the Hood. He imitates both men and women. He seems to genuinely like America and Americans, but there are also things that puzzle him about how Americans pronounce words, and certain uses of words that differ from how they are used in South Africa and other places. Puzzles over, for example, how America-centric our news and interests are vs. South Africa insofar as they are aware of what is going on in America and American television and Americans know little or next to nothing about South Africa.

But if you have not spent time and Trevor Noah you are in for a treat. I found it fun, entertaining, and interesting.

I had my doubts when I purchased the rental but after watching the first few minutes I realized I had made the right call.  Trevor Noah is hilarious and clever.  He creates metaphor and simile with daily life material.  Very clever and witty.  After it was over, I looked up to see if he had more material in Amazon but did not find anything.  I guess I will have to wait until he takes over The Daily Show.
Hilarious.

This was a joyless romp through one man's stab at observational humor. As for his material, it felt like watching an archer nock one splintered arrow after another in a misguided attempt to hit his target. His timing, however, was good; his delivery was clean and his words springboarded gracefully from his tongue, but that simply wasn't enough to make up for the content that was very seriously wanting. Yes, I get you're from Africa and pronounce "Zebra" differently. Welcome to America: we're glad you're here, but we don't care.
wao, his kind is rare, potential candidate for presidency.

Really great introduction to Trevor Noah; must see video as a primer to the new Daily Show host.  Of course I wanted to know more about the person taking over for Jon Stewart and gain insight as to how and maybe why he got the job and after watching this video I am really psyched to see what he does with The Daily Show when it starts up again. I thought he was witty and entertaining and it was a fun experience. I urge everyone to take a look and find out more about this person. This is sort of his debut to American audiences so it is worth your time and consideration.

I tried really hard to like this guy's standup.  But it's just too full of problems and poorly done research to be funny.  One of his issues with American English is the notion that "pound" is not properly abbreviated: specifically, "lb" has no connection to "pound" and Americans are therefore abusing the language to use it.  Except that even a cursory etymological search would reveal that lb is short for the latin "libra," from which "libra pondo" (pound weight) was abbreviated.

It's this sort of poorly informed joke that he tosses about in his standup, and just doesn't appeal to me.  This man is not only no replacement for Jon Stewart, he's just not funny.  I had to stop watching 20 or so minutes in, because I just wasn't laughing.  Same for the other three folks I forced to watch this.

I have still not come to terms with the fact that we are losing Jon Stewart from The Daily Show beginning in August, so I thought I would give Trever Noah's stand-up a chance before he takes over the desk at TDS.  He didn't seem very comfortable with the audience enough times throughout the performance that it was even uncomfortable from my living room, as well. Many of the jokes where America (or Americans) was held lacking in comparison to the rest of the world didn't really go over well with the audience, and it seemed to be a theme for much of his routine.  I have to say that for my first impression of his own material, I was not impressed, overall.

*** This review may contain spoilers ***

Noah presents as a sweet yearning kid in a candy store. What a delight to hear tales of my home country which you rarely appreciate from a foreigner's eyes. He details many comic interpretations of our customs and language and delivers in a serious hilarious manner.

I have greatly diminished my view of the USA as powerful, mighty, and enchanting. However, this young man envisions a country that I was once familiar and then instilled what remaining pride I had into overwhelming joy. Albeit the strong arm policies were duly noted and appreciated. He wants to fit in and his praises may be overstated but I welcomed them nonetheless.

Replacing Jon is going to present a major challenge and after watching this talented handsome man with a broad variety of accents and cheery demeanor, he just might make it work. Best of luck to you Noah!

High recommend for South African experience, foreigner POV of USA, and a sneak peak of The Daily Show replacement.

He is very funny and honestly talking about his experiences after coming to the USA. We came from the Netherlands in 1978, and many of his problems/experiences are very familiar to us.  We visited America several times before as a tourist, settling in a new country is a whole different story. We spoke British English with a Dutch accent like Trevor with a South African. We had plenty of time (37 years) to adjust, became USA citizens, and the few times we visited Family in the Netherlands they claim us to speak Dutch with an American accent. You never win, LOL.

I first watched this comedy special on Showtime and had to purchase it soon afterward. Trevor's comedy is such a breath of fresh air. He is smart, funny, and hearing him speak about his experiences growing up as a bi-racial South African is hilarious! I'm a new fan and I'm looking forward to see what he's dropping next.

I think he is one of the funniest rising comedians out there right now. I first heard about him opening for Gabriel Iglesias and recently saw him on The Daily Show. He does use some foul language, but not nearly as much as Chris Rock or Katt Williams. Many of his standup shows are not available in the US, but this one is hilarious and will have to tide us over until he releases the other stuff here. You can download "You Laugh But It's True" at trevornoah.com. He is very funny, educated, and well-traveled and does a good job of pointing out many things that America does entirely different from the rest of the world in a humorous way.

This guy is hilarious but there were many repeat jokes used on this DVD
We love Trevor Noah, Thank You.
excellent comedian
Hilarious dude!
very smart, very funny,
A total riot! Trevor Noah is hilarious. Thought out points of view and FUNNY! You'll bust your gut (Oprah, Nah-mean?). Can't wait to get more of his stand-up routines.
Hilarious!
He is very funny without being obscene. I would definitely recommend.
Hilariously South African.
Trevor Noah is hilarious and his jokes are pretty clean!

Really excellent comic. I think anyone would like his humour, but if you happen to speak more than one language, and if you have lived in other countries, then you will find his humour especially funny.
I have been very impressed with the wayTrevor sees the world, Hope to see more of his comedy in the future!
When I laugh so hard that I have tears in my eyes (again, on the second viewing!) watching a comedian, I know I'm having a good time. This kid is very good.

Trevor Noah was not someone I had heard of before, but I'm thrilled that I tried! He's hilarious!!! Very real and fresh material, and it's good clean comedy. Definitely worth the purchase! You'll want to watch it over and over again.

This was very funny! So funny, I bought it! I had watched it when it was free on Netflix but it was taken down and I wanted to watch it again. I've watched this several times and I like his humor! Highly recommend!
His views on american culture are the most entertaining jokes I've heard in awhile. I will have to check out his earlier work.

I am a South African living in the US (7 years) so I am a little biased, but this is pretty damn awesome. Comedians depend very much on personal preference, but as long as you are cool with someone playfully taking the piss out of the US attitudes towards race and global politics you should enjoy it. Easily better and less predictable than 95% of the comedy I am exposed to these days.

My sister recommended this comedian to me and I'm glad she did. He's pretty funny and intriguing. It's always interesting listening to someone who isn't from America talk about their experiences here. He also has other shows that involve other places he's visited but obviously me being American found this one very entertaining.

This is probably the best stand-up comedy routine I have ever seen.  I laughed non-stop from beginning to end.  Great stand-up routine to give as a gift since his comedy is extremely funny without being vulgar and full of profanity.  People of all ages and backgrounds can enjoy.  Buy a few copies and give the gift of laughter to the people in your life!!

I am a South African married to an American. Trevor noah sums up all the hilarious differences between the two cultures. Even as an American you will love the way trevor describes his initial experience. Definitely worth purchasing to watch over and over again
This is funny stuff. There is a lot of truth behind comedy. That's what makes it resonate with us, ultimately making it funny. Noah articulates the follies of our society with skill.

Trevor Noah's comedy is not just your typical standup routine. He is amazing at fusion of how the rest of the world sees America and our culture. You need some level of intellect to understand many hidden historical references. He is remarkable.
I keep watching this and cannot stop laughing! So hilarious, I look forward to and cant wait to see more!

This is a great standup routine.
This comedian is very smart and every second is awesome.
Get this DVD and share this comedian with your friends.
didn't stop laughing from his first word to the last. Too funny. Very smart too and witty, and he can think on the spot and come with really funny and clever material. Bravo!
I really like comedy that's not foul. Trevor Noah is really funny with out the foulness. Looking to see some more of his shows

This guy is "da bomb"!  I highly recommend attending any show this guy is in.  My sides still hurt from laughing.  It was wonderful to see the USA through his eyes.  Rent it - buy it - whatever it takes  you will not be disappointed because this guy is hilarious!
Very entertaining, bright and funny young man.  Very much worth the time to watch him.  Hope to see more of him.

Trevor comes from a standpoint of a non-american and really shows in a comitic fashion how we should look at ourselves.  From beginning to end, he brings the laughter.  A staple for anyone who enjoys comedy.
Loved it! It really shows how our country is stuck on itself! I'd love to see him in person! awesome

It is extremely rare to find a stand up comic special that legitimately keeps you laughing from start to finish. Trevor Noah's set is definitely one of them. Very little profanity, if any appears. With a sharp wit and a riffing humor Mr. Noah makes the time invested in his jokes worth it.
Just when you think you've heard it all... He is Fresh, New, Great Entertainment and Skill.. Thank You Trevor Noah
This is a one of the best stand up's I've ever seen. He is hilarious and he doesn't even swear a lot
Perfect comedy! Well worth sharing with everyone! I'd love to see him live! I was sad when netflix took him off streaming!

I love this comedian! For a good laugh, this clean talking but extremely funny man is it. I wish there were more shows to choose. Not just jokes either. He talks about current themes and makes you think even though you're laughing at the same time.

I was introduced to Trevor Noah via Netflix and I am glad I was. He is hilarious. Everything he says is right on point. I love hearing the perspective of an outsider on America delivered in a genuine way. If you don't find him funny, hit mute and just watch. Did I mention he is also fun to look at? If he ever comes to Kansas City, I will be first online buying my ticket. If he goes to Chicago, ROADTRIP! I have told everyone I know that loves to laugh about this man. He is fantastic. I am on Amazon trying to buy the DVD. All I am finding are streaming copies. Boo Amazon!...There is also a documentary that follows Trevor leading up to his first one man performance in South Africa before he exploded that was filmed in 2009 by an American college student and this was his thesis project. It has been released and I highly recommend it. You will fall in love with Trevor all over again.

I have to say that I was already a Trevor Noah fan before I watched this video. I had seen him on Youtube and watched a bunch of his videos multiple times, laughing hard every time. He is extremely clever and has an amazing ability to imitate accents. You will be amazed at how this South African can effortlessly sound like a White businessman, Black rapper or a Puerto Rican. That's in addition to his own native South African accent, an LA Valley girl and even a Japanese man. Fantastic and very entertaining! If you check him out on Youtube youll see that he is hilarious doing Aussie, Brit, Indian and different South African accents as well.

This particular routine was hit and miss in a lot of places though. When he talked about being mixed race as a one way street (you can go from Mixed-Race to Black but never Mixed-Race to White) that was funny and insightful. He pointed out a racist contradiction but I didn't feel judged. I just laughed and thought Wow, hes right!. Other jokes (the US doesnt use the metric system, African Americans are not African, Italian Americans are not Italian, etc.) made him sound like a whiny, smug European. Trevor Noah is a very funny man but this is not his best performance.
Funny and innovative, his language skills are great.  Watched on New Years with family and friends and it was great!
This guy is hilarious!  But the humor rings so true.  I've watched it numerous times and it gets funnier each time

Brilliantly hilarious a must see!!!!
A superstar in the making.
Clean honest comedy.
Just go out and buy it already..

Beautiful Intelligent Blackman!...with such keen insight and  a  class of humor that is refreshing!!!....thought provoking truth telling ...he has what makes a Great!!! Comedian....and that is thee ability! to ..Tell!!! a Story!...in a way the audience follows every! word!...

I will say that this young Brotha! is..."Blacker"! then many Black people I run into these days that were... born! in America!  and by that I mean....his! state of...CONSCIOUSNESS!!!....and I LOOOOVE!!! his!...Style! of comedy...

  From A Sista! Born in ...America....Brooklyn!!!! (Smile)....N.Y.

Be Blessed always my Young Brotha and....Truth! Teacher!....TEACH!!!(Smile).....

This young man is extremely funny AND intelligent.  I haven't laughed this hard in quite a while. I've turned him on to several of my friends and hand evening gatherings at my house to watch him. Can't wait until he comes back to the U.S.
I recently learned about this up and coming comedian after renting his new dvd at redbox. I enjoyed it so much that I decided I wanted to purchase it.
As an African-American male (with mixed ancestry as Trevor Noah), it is nice to delve into the humorous appreciation of this race.

Ordered this over the Christmas Holiday for viewing and laughter by my relatives.  They had not seen him before and
have since purchased his DVD.  How wonderfully refreshing to hear about our culture as seen from another,
especially from South Africa. Funny with lots of humor.

He is incredibly funny.. Really puts a spin on things that we as Americans sometimes just don't think about.. He is very Diverse giving us  African, Japanese, Chinese, Puerto Rican , Arab, Jamaican, Latino, Iranian, Caucasian, and African American accents, and impressions. So many of his jokes are so real and so funny.. I saw this show on TV one night and just adored him so much that I bought this DVD on amazon. After getting it I didn't get a chance to watch it because I was letting all of my friends borrow it left and right I didn't get it back for almost two months and everyone who borrowed it loved it.. I even had a get together at my house and played this DVD. Imagine 15 plus people of all races in a living room cracking up glued to the TV, I loved it.. People were asking me who is this guy he's hilarious.. So I later bought a second DVD in fear of loosing this one or it getting damaged from all the use.. Did I mention he's Handsome too a face like that can make you smile by it self.. GET IT YOU WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED.

Haven't laughed this much during a comedy show in a long, long time. Usually if I can laugh out loud two or three times during a show I consider the comedian to be pretty good. The bar was set fairly low because of what's out there nowadays. This comedian raises the bar in so many ways. This is a relatively "clean" show, with a few curse words here and there, but like Sinbad, he's so gifted at what he does, cursing is unnecessary. I'd give this show 10 stars if I could.

Not only is he funny, but he addresses the obsession with America's need to categorize every single individual's race or culture, and how incorrectly this is done.  I would advise everyone to watch.  He does not hold his tongue, and its WELL WORTH IT!

This is one crazy guy ever! Everything he say about coming to America for first time is so true and funny at the same time! From word pronouncing to counting! I like the fact that he is funny without swearing. Great job trevor I suggest this DVD to anyone u won't regret
The brother is just fantastic, really enjoyed this DVD , just like the others in my collection of him. Go Trevor!

As a South African of mixed race, Mr. Noah brings a unique perspective to race in America.  Gently, and with great humor and love, he will blow the top of your head off if you have any preconceived notions about black and white.  Or, I could say, this is good, clean, laugh a minute entertainment.
A man who is not afraid to tell it like it is in the funniest way possible. A very good buy.
Funny and a refreshing type of comedy that you don't typically see. Trevor uses his intellect and world view to entertain all types of audiences.
This young man's gift is a true blessing!  I appreciated this performance so much, I bought a copy for each person in my family!

Intelligent humor...I wish I could see more of Trevor's performances (alas I found more but they are recorded on 'region 2' dvd and my player cannot play that region....hopefully someone will put the other performances on dvd 'region 1' soon, so that we here in the states can see more of this funny comedian!
Caught part of his show on Showtime and had to rent it to watch the whole thing. Was well worth it. He is hilarious!

Trevor does not hold back on his satire and he knows how to deliver sensitive information in a great way. Was very clean and was refreshing from a lot of other comics out there. Him being from South Africa, he has done a great job crossing over. Me being from Zambia and having brothers that live in South Africa, I can definitely relate.
I love Trevor Noah's style of comedy. It's clean(something my parents would have let me watch as a kid) and I'd recommend it to anybody.
Simply lovely... Enjoyed his freshness, sincerity, humility.. and oh so cute to watch... Thank-you for the laughs..
I really enjoyed his routine. I learned a lot and laughed at the same time.
fabulous, funny and thoughtful. As an outsider he can see the quirks and foibles of American culture.
very funny
I wish I could give half a star.
I'm so happy to finally own this as an Instant Video. Don't read the negative reviews. Trevor Noah is honest, insightful, and funny. I highly recommend to all.
It was slightly funny until I realized how racist he actually is.
love it

I loved it.  So...when is he coming out with more?  The only other stand-up comedy DVD of his I could find either was not available or I couldn't afford it.  I'd already read his book Born a Crime and was anxious to see more of him/by him.
Excellent from beginning to end!
